Bachelor & Vlad the Younger

1.Vlad the Younger: You've found me here? Oh well, I'm not surprised. I suppose you're not too surprised by the fact that everyone knows about you either. The rumour of your arrival spread like fire. Why have you come?

1.Vlad the Younger: You've found me here? Oh well, I'm not surprised. I suppose you're not too surprised by the fact that everyone knows about you either. The rumour of your arrival spread like fire. Why have you come?

2.Bachelor: I've come for some sightseeing.

2.Bachelor: I've come for some sightseeing.

3.Vlad the Younger: There was a peculiar incident yesterday by the Spleen. The children were playing in the mud as usual, but then suddenly they ran away from the sandbox and the parents noticed that their hands were smothered in blood. However, none of them were wounded. Neither were any of them surprised.

3.Vlad the Younger: There was a peculiar incident yesterday by the Spleen. The children were playing in the mud as usual, but then suddenly they ran away from the sandbox and the parents noticed that their hands were smothered in blood. However, none of them were wounded. Neither were any of them surprised.

4.Bachelor: What's the solution to the puzzle?

4.Bachelor: What's the solution to the puzzle?

5.Vlad the Younger: ...When the worried adults came to the place where the children had been playing, they found nothing unusual there, only sticks and stones. What do you make of it?

5.Vlad the Younger: ...When the worried adults came to the place where the children had been playing, they found nothing unusual there, only sticks and stones. What do you make of it?

6.Bachelor: Your children play peculiar games.

6.Bachelor: Your children play peculiar games.

7.Vlad the Younger: Nice to meet a person of a sceptical mind. I am Vladislav Olgimsky. The younger one, of course. And you are, of course, Daniil Dankovsky.

7.Vlad the Younger: Nice to meet a person of a sceptical mind. I am Vladislav Olgimsky. The younger one, of course. And you are, of course, Daniil Dankovsky.

8.Bachelor: Yes, that is me.

8.Bachelor: Yes, that is me.

8.Bachelor: Nice to meet you.

8.Bachelor: Nice to meet you.

6.Bachelor: Ah, nothing special. They probably dug out a dead cat.

6.Bachelor: Ah, nothing special. They probably dug out a dead cat.

7.Vlad the Younger: Nice to meet a person of a sceptical mind. I am Vladislav Olgimsky. The younger one, of course. And you are, of course, Daniil Dankovsky.

7.Vlad the Younger: Nice to meet a person of a sceptical mind. I am Vladislav Olgimsky. The younger one, of course. And you are, of course, Daniil Dankovsky.

8.Bachelor: Yes, that is me.

8.Bachelor: Yes, that is me.

8.Bachelor: Nice to meet you.

8.Bachelor: Nice to meet you.

4.Bachelor: Such things happen all the time.

4.Bachelor: Such things happen all the time.

5.Vlad the Younger: Nice to meet a person of a sceptical mind. I am Vladislav Olgimsky. The younger one, of course. And you are, of course, Daniil Dankovsky.

5.Vlad the Younger: Nice to meet a person of a sceptical mind. I am Vladislav Olgimsky. The younger one, of course. And you are, of course, Daniil Dankovsky.

6.Bachelor: Yes, that is me.

6.Bachelor: Yes, that is me.

6.Bachelor: Nice to meet you.

6.Bachelor: Nice to meet you.

1.Vlad the Younger: We'll have to figure out how to keep on living.

1.Vlad the Younger: We'll have to figure out how to keep on living.

2.Bachelor: I've come at Lara Ravel's request.

2.Bachelor: I've come at Lara Ravel's request.

3.Vlad the Younger: Yes, I remember the arrangement. Here's what I can personally donate. It's a pity I can't extort a nicer sum from my father.

3.Vlad the Younger: Yes, I remember the arrangement. Here's what I can personally donate. It's a pity I can't extort a nicer sum from my father.

4.Bachelor: Can he be convinced somehow?

4.Bachelor: Can he be convinced somehow?

5.Vlad the Younger: It's no use even trying.

5.Vlad the Younger: It's no use even trying.

6.Bachelor: Really? Why?

6.Bachelor: Really? Why?

7.Vlad the Younger: He has his own opinion on the matter. I think he accepts that you might be right-he accepts it, but he won't admit it. See the difference? Obviously, getting solid proof is disadvantageous to him for some reason. Not to mention that it would immediately cause him expenses...

7.Vlad the Younger: He has his own opinion on the matter. I think he accepts that you might be right-he accepts it, but he won't admit it. See the difference? Obviously, getting solid proof is disadvantageous to him for some reason. Not to mention that it would immediately cause him expenses...

8.Bachelor: I can see the difference, but I don't understand the game he's playing.

8.Bachelor: I can see the difference, but I don't understand the game he's playing.

9.Vlad the Younger: I am not going to discuss that. I can only sympathize with you and advise you against disturbing my father with this question.

9.Vlad the Younger: I am not going to discuss that. I can only sympathize with you and advise you against disturbing my father with this question.

10.Bachelor: I don't like this.

10.Bachelor: I don't like this.

10.Bachelor: I see.

10.Bachelor: I see.

4.Bachelor: Nevermind. This is enough.

4.Bachelor: Nevermind. This is enough.

2.Bachelor: Tell me, master Vlad, do you believe that we're facing a real epidemic hazard?

2.Bachelor: Tell me, master Vlad, do you believe that we're facing a real epidemic hazard?

3.Vlad the Younger: I still don't understand how you came to the conclusion that the disease which killed Simon is contagious. Even if we assume that the rumours of a death carrier are nothing but rumours... which I doubt.

3.Vlad the Younger: I still don't understand how you came to the conclusion that the disease which killed Simon is contagious. Even if we assume that the rumours of a death carrier are nothing but rumours... which I doubt.

4.Bachelor: Call it intuition, if you will.

4.Bachelor: Call it intuition, if you will.

5.Vlad the Younger: If you are right, Bachelor, and there really is going to be a Sand Plague epidemic in this town, there will be no stopping it. You don't need to waste your life, and you cannot help us in any way. Your only goal is to survive until the Station is reopened.

5.Vlad the Younger: If you are right, Bachelor, and there really is going to be a Sand Plague epidemic in this town, there will be no stopping it. You don't need to waste your life, and you cannot help us in any way. Your only goal is to survive until the Station is reopened.

6.Bachelor: Peculiar fatalism. Are you saying that the services of an educated medic won't be of any help to you?

6.Bachelor: Peculiar fatalism. Are you saying that the services of an educated medic won't be of any help to you?

7.Vlad the Younger: Education is of no use here. Isidor may have had no medical education, but he managed to drive the demon back to hell. By the way, he mentioned that one can't beat the plague by traditional means.

7.Vlad the Younger: Education is of no use here. Isidor may have had no medical education, but he managed to drive the demon back to hell. By the way, he mentioned that one can't beat the plague by traditional means.

8.Bachelor: What means can it be beaten with then?

8.Bachelor: What means can it be beaten with then?

9.Vlad the Younger: It cannot be beaten. Isidor was a wise man. He was born here and knew many things that no education can provide. Bachelor, your goal is to survive. Save your talent for the Capital. Leave this place. My father will be happy to assist you.

9.Vlad the Younger: It cannot be beaten. Isidor was a wise man. He was born here and knew many things that no education can provide. Bachelor, your goal is to survive. Save your talent for the Capital. Leave this place. My father will be happy to assist you.

10.Bachelor: I'll speak to your father.

10.Bachelor: I'll speak to your father.

10.Bachelor: Thank you for the advice, but I will decide what to do with my talent on my own.

10.Bachelor: Thank you for the advice, but I will decide what to do with my talent on my own.

8.Bachelor: I will find my own way to stop the disease.

8.Bachelor: I will find my own way to stop the disease.

6.Bachelor: According to certain people, even that won't be an easy task.

6.Bachelor: According to certain people, even that won't be an easy task.

6.Bachelor: When will the Station be reopened?

6.Bachelor: When will the Station be reopened?

7.Vlad the Younger: It’s probably best to aim for the time after they've stopped hunting the maneater and before the town is quarantined... Speak with my father.

7.Vlad the Younger: It’s probably best to aim for the time after they've stopped hunting the maneater and before the town is quarantined... Speak with my father.

8.Bachelor: I will.

8.Bachelor: I will.

4.Bachelor: There has already been an outbreak of an unknown disease in your town. I used to occasionally communicate with Isidor Burakh, the man who put an end to it.

4.Bachelor: There has already been an outbreak of an unknown disease in your town. I used to occasionally communicate with Isidor Burakh, the man who put an end to it.

5.Vlad the Younger: ...But I'm sure Isidor never told you about this. The brief encounter with the Sand Plague put him in a state of primal terror. Did you know that? His opinion of his role in stopping the outbreak was not very high... and he ascribed that victory solely to circumstance.

5.Vlad the Younger: ...But I'm sure Isidor never told you about this. The brief encounter with the Sand Plague put him in a state of primal terror. Did you know that? His opinion of his role in stopping the outbreak was not very high... and he ascribed that victory solely to circumstance.

6.Bachelor: It's strange he didn't suspect anything when examining Simon...

1.Vlad the Younger: How can I help you?

1.Vlad the Younger: How can I help you?

2.Bachelor: Rubin's disappeared. His home has been infected and looted. Neither his body nor Simon's was there. Where could he have gone?

2.Bachelor: Rubin's disappeared. His home has been infected and looted. Neither his body nor Simon's was there. Where could he have gone?

3.Vlad the Younger: I don't know. I haven't seen him. Do you suspect that Rubin is dead?

3.Vlad the Younger: I don't know. I haven't seen him. Do you suspect that Rubin is dead?

4.Bachelor: I do.

4.Bachelor: I do.

5.Vlad the Younger: Well, if neither Rubin nor Simon were in the dead house, that means Rubin has at least attempted to move the Keeper's body to another place. Otherwise we would have to surmise that someone has stolen two infected bodies with peculiarly obscure purposes. Wouldn't you agree?

5.Vlad the Younger: Well, if neither Rubin nor Simon were in the dead house, that means Rubin has at least attempted to move the Keeper's body to another place. Otherwise we would have to surmise that someone has stolen two infected bodies with peculiarly obscure purposes. Wouldn't you agree?

6.Bachelor: You're reading my mind.

6.Bachelor: You're reading my mind.

7.Vlad the Younger: I find it hard to believe that the body's been stolen. No madman could ransom it to the Kains and get away alive, and you could never find the kind of blasphemer who would defile it out of sheer malice. Rubin will make himself known soon, you'll see.

7.Vlad the Younger: I find it hard to believe that the body's been stolen. No madman could ransom it to the Kains and get away alive, and you could never find the kind of blasphemer who would defile it out of sheer malice. Rubin will make himself known soon, you'll see.

8.Bachelor: And still I beg for your assistance. There is no doubt in my mind that you have a theory of your own.

8.Bachelor: And still I beg for your assistance. There is no doubt in my mind that you have a theory of your own.

9.Vlad the Younger: Look... Rubin's dealings with our family are... our family's business. We value his trust. I don't feel that disclosing the details to you would be the right thing to do-not unless I see that... hmmm... the family would benefit more than it would suffer from that exchange. Do you understand?

9.Vlad the Younger: Look... Rubin's dealings with our family are... our family's business. We value his trust. I don't feel that disclosing the details to you would be the right thing to do-not unless I see that... hmmm... the family would benefit more than it would suffer from that exchange. Do you understand?

10.Bachelor: In all honesty, I don't.

10.Bachelor: In all honesty, I don't.

11.Vlad the Younger: I want to settle the dispute between us and the Kains concerning our unwillingness to let emissaries into the Termitary. I don't know what the Kains are thinking, but we are not harbouring anything or anyone there that could be of even remote interest to them-especially to my deeply esteemed fellow Victor.

11.Vlad the Younger: I want to settle the dispute between us and the Kains concerning our unwillingness to let emissaries into the Termitary. I don't know what the Kains are thinking, but we are not harbouring anything or anyone there that could be of even remote interest to them-especially to my deeply esteemed fellow Victor.

12.Bachelor: So why don't you let the inspectors in?

12.Bachelor: So why don't you let the inspectors in?

13.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

13.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

14.Bachelor: Fine. What's your plan?

14.Bachelor: Fine. What's your plan?

15.Vlad the Younger: The Kains are hiding something too... They have their own skeleton in the closet, and it's even more unsightly than ours. Our closet is full of our own workers; theirs is full of other people's children. If you can make sure that... everything is well inside the Polyhedron, then trust me, the Termitary is fine too. It's an enclave. A closed chamber.

15.Vlad the Younger: The Kains are hiding something too... They have their own skeleton in the closet, and it's even more unsightly than ours. Our closet is full of our own workers; theirs is full of other people's children. If you can make sure that... everything is well inside the Polyhedron, then trust me, the Termitary is fine too. It's an enclave. A closed chamber.

16.Bachelor: So you believe that quarantine will be effective in keeping the infection out of that giant bunkhouse?

16.Bachelor: So you believe that quarantine will be effective in keeping the infection out of that giant bunkhouse?

17.Vlad the Younger: Certainly. Did you not say yourself-at least that's how it was relayed to me-that walls are a solid defense? Besides, think of what will happen if ten thousand people pour into the streets in search of food and gossip. Try to imagine the picture.

17.Vlad the Younger: Certainly. Did you not say yourself-at least that's how it was relayed to me-that walls are a solid defense? Besides, think of what will happen if ten thousand people pour into the streets in search of food and gossip. Try to imagine the picture.

18.Bachelor: Sounds convincing. I'll inspect the Polyhedron and talk to Victor, but I'll ask a favour of you in return: help me find Simon's body.

18.Bachelor: Sounds convincing. I'll inspect the Polyhedron and talk to Victor, but I'll ask a favour of you in return: help me find Simon's body.

19.Vlad the Younger: Try to curb the righteous anger of the Judge and the terrible Victor; they seem to have finally decided to harass my father to death. I have no doubt that no matter what he did, it's not his fault. If you do that, I will gladly assist you.

19.Vlad the Younger: Try to curb the righteous anger of the Judge and the terrible Victor; they seem to have finally decided to harass my father to death. I have no doubt that no matter what he did, it's not his fault. If you do that, I will gladly assist you.

20.Bachelor: Deal.

10.Bachelor: I do.

11.Vlad the Younger: I want to settle the dispute between us and the Kains concerning our unwillingness to let emissaries into the Termitary. 12.Bachelor: So why don't you let the inspectors in?

12.Bachelor: So why don't you let the inspectors in?

13.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

13.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

14.Bachelor: Fine. What's your plan?

15.Vlad the Younger: The Kains are hiding something too... They have their own skeleton in the closet, and it's even more unsightly than ours. Our closet is full of our own workers; theirs is full of other people's children. If you can make sure that... everything is well inside the Polyhedron, then trust me, the Termitary is fine too. It's an enclave. A closed chamber.

16.Bachelor: Sounds convincing. I'll inspect the Polyhedron and talk to Victor, but I'll ask a favour of you in return: help me find Simon's body.

17.Vlad the Younger: Try to curb the righteous anger of the Judge and the terrible Victor; they seem to have finally decided to harass my father to death. I have no doubt that no matter what he did, it's not his fault. If you do that, I will gladly assist you.

18.Bachelor: Deal.

9.Vlad the Younger: Look... Rubin's dealings with our family are... our family's business. We value his trust. I don't feel that disclosing the details to you would be the right thing to do-not unless I see that... hmmm... the family would benefit more than it would suffer from that exchange. Do you understand?

11.Vlad the Younger: I want to settle the dispute between us and the Kains concerning our unwillingness to let emissaries into the Termitary. 12.Bachelor: So why don't you let the inspectors in?

13.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

13.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

14.Bachelor: Fine. What's your plan?

15.Vlad the Younger: The Kains are hiding something too... They have their own skeleton in the closet, and it's even more unsightly than ours. Our closet is full of our own workers; theirs is full of other people's children. If you can make sure that... everything is well inside the Polyhedron, then trust me, the Termitary is fine too. It's an enclave. A closed chamber.

4.Bachelor: Why should I suspect that?

5.Vlad the Younger: If Rubin were alive, he would undoubtedly make his whereabouts known. And he certainly wouldn't keep quiet about the pest getting inside the town. He's one of the few who have an actual understanding of what that entails.

6.Bachelor: Is that what you think?

6.Bachelor: Is that what you think?

7.Vlad the Younger: Well, if neither Rubin nor Simon were in the dead house, that means Rubin has at least attempted to move the Keeper's body to another place. Otherwise we would have to surmise that someone has stolen two infected bodies with peculiarly obscure purposes. Wouldn't you agree?

8.Bachelor: You're reading my mind.

8.Bachelor: You're reading my mind.

9.Vlad the Younger: I find it hard to believe that the body's been stolen. No madman could ransom it to the Kains and get away alive, and you could never find the kind of blasphemer who would defile it out of sheer malice. Rubin will make himself known soon, you'll see.

10.Bachelor: And still I beg for your assistance. There is no doubt in my mind that you have a theory of your own.

11.Vlad the Younger: Look... Rubin's dealings with our family are... our family's business. We value his trust. I don't feel that disclosing the details to you would be the right thing to do-not unless I see that... hmmm... the family would benefit more than it would suffer from that exchange. Do you understand?

13.Vlad the Younger: I want to settle the dispute between us and the Kains concerning our unwillingness to let emissaries into the Termitary. 14.Bachelor: So why don't you let the inspectors in?

15.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

15.Vlad the Younger: First of all, it's dangerous. The rabble is rioting. I've told you about that more than once already. Secondly, father will not submit to the younger Kain's orders. If this keeps up, we'll soon be taking orders from his ten-year-old son!

16.Bachelor: Fine. What's your plan?

16.Bachelor: Fine. What's your plan?

17.Vlad the Younger: The Kains are hiding something too... They have their own skeleton in the closet, and it's even more unsightly than ours. Our closet is full of our own workers; theirs is full of other people's children. If you can make sure that... everything is well inside the Polyhedron, then trust me, the Termitary is fine too. It's an enclave. A closed chamber.

17.Vlad the Younger: The Kains are hiding something too... They have their own skeleton in the closet, and it's even more unsightly than ours. 16.Bachelor: Nothing much. The information concerning the disappearance of Simon Kain's body-specifically the place where Rubin could have taken it.

17.Vlad the Younger: The Kains are hiding something too... They have their own skeleton in the closet, and it's even more unsightly than ours. Our closet is full of our own workers; theirs is full of other people's children. If you can make sure that... everything is well inside the Polyhedron, then trust me, the Termitary is fine too. It's an enclave. A closed chamber.

18.Bachelor: So you believe that quarantine will be effective in keeping the infection out of that giant bunkhouse?

19.Vlad the Younger: Certainly. Did you not say yourself-at least that's how it was relayed to me-that walls are a solid defense? Besides, think of what will happen if ten thousand people pour into the streets in search of food and gossip. Try to imagine the picture.

20.Bachelor: Sounds convincing. I'll inspect the Polyhedron and talk to Victor, but I'll ask a favour of you in return: help me find Simon's body.

It's an enclave. A closed chamber.

11.Vlad the Younger: I want to settle the dispute between us and the Kains concerning our unwillingness to let emissaries into the Termitary. 2.Bachelor: There are some very peculiar attitudes about the dead in your town...

2.Bachelor: There are some very peculiar attitudes about the dead in your town...

3.Vlad the Younger: Yes. They are derived from pagan superstition. The body is considered to be the sum of all truths; the ligaments keeping it whole-to be the ligaments of the universe. It must not be taken apart without the knowledge of how those dissection cuts will reverberate in the makeup of the universe.

3.Vlad the Younger: Yes. They are derived from pagan superstition. The body is considered to be the sum of all truths; the ligaments keeping it whole-to be the ligaments of the universe. It must not be taken apart without the knowledge of how those dissection cuts will reverberate in the makeup of the universe.

4.Bachelor: And you share in that superstition?

4.Bachelor: And you share in that superstition?

5.Vlad the Younger: A body is a self-contained system. Sometimes it's fascinating to take note of how ingenious its natural design is. Not a single useless part. Even atavisms, such as the coccyx, serve to add certain charm. Everything is in harmony.

5.Vlad the Younger: A body is a self-contained system. Sometimes it's fascinating to take note of how ingenious its natural design is. Not a single useless part. Even atavisms, such as the coccyx, serve to add certain charm. Everything is in harmony.

6.Bachelor: But the system is easily disrupted.

6.Bachelor: But the system is easily disrupted.

7.Vlad the Younger: Yes-when an alien object interferes. Like a bullet, a knife, or a foreign organism. Is it true what they say about microbes being sentient?

7.Vlad the Younger: Yes-when an alien object interferes. Like a bullet, a knife, or a foreign organism. Is it true what they say about microbes being sentient?

8.Bachelor: Age kills a person even in a perfect environment. I have devoted my professional fortunes to this regrettable fact.

9.Vlad the Younger: Simon has proven otherwise. The Kains used that as a foundation for a new era. Incidentally, I don't understand what Georgiy's frustration; what does it matter if Simon was undone by a murderer's blade or by an infectious filth? Both things are equally foreign intereference.

2.Bachelor: How come there's no water in the town?

2.Bachelor: How come there's no water in the town?

3.Vlad the Younger: The town's water supply's been sabotaged and ruined! To be more precise, we've lost the purifying system on the water intake that supplies water from the Gorkhon to people's homes.

3.Vlad the Younger: The town's water supply's been sabotaged and ruined! To be more precise, we've lost the purifying system on the water intake that supplies water from the Gorkhon to people's homes.

4.Bachelor: How did that happen?

4.Bachelor: How did that happen?

5.Vlad the Younger: The local blockheads, egged on by some overly active taskmaster, destroyed the water supply to prevent infected water from getting into the town. Can you see it now? I'm telling you, the crowd is rough...

10.Bachelor: The Sugagh Khadugh spring?

10.Bachelor: The Sugagh Khadugh spring?

11.Vlad the Younger: When Sugagh Khadugh was crushed, it flowed underground, but then returned to the surface. The locals maintain that it was angry with people, so it's chosen an evil place to do that. Popped out like a varicose vein in a place dramatically unfit for producing drinking water: by the cemetery, the Rotten Field, and the Khato dead pile.

11.Vlad the Younger: When Sugagh Khadugh was crushed, it flowed underground, but then returned to the surface. The locals maintain that it was angry with people, so it's chosen an evil place to do that. Popped out like a varicose vein in a place dramatically unfit for producing drinking water: by the cemetery, the Rotten Field, and the Khato dead pile.

4.Bachelor: What does the local water supply look like?

4.Bachelor: What does the local water supply look like?

5.Vlad the Younger: It exists; there even is a water supply system-which is in itself quite amazing, don't you think? It was constructed after the fire, at the same time as the Termitary. The water pumps you've doubtlessly noticed in the streets are also connected to it. But that's not all.

5.Vlad the Younger: It exists; there even is a water supply system-which is in itself quite amazing, don't you think? It was constructed after the fire, at the same time as the Termitary. The water pumps you've doubtlessly noticed in the streets are also connected to it. But that's not all.

6.Bachelor: What else?

6.Bachelor: What else?

7.Vlad the Younger: There are several springs inside the town and in the surrounding Steppe. They all have beautiful names in the local language. Three of them are in the town: by the Cathedral, by the Theatre, and... well, the third one was ruined during the construction of the Bull Project. It dried up.

7.Vlad the Younger: There are several springs inside the town and in the surrounding Steppe. They all have beautiful names in the local language. Three of them are in the town: by the Cathedral, by the Theatre, and... well, the third one was ruined during the construction of the Bull Project. It dried up.

8.Bachelor: There must be some wells too.

8.Bachelor: There must be some wells too.

9.Vlad the Younger: Sadly, no wells; that's another local taboo that is most likely going to make your work harder. This is all quite unfortunate, wouldn't you agree? But well-digging is forbidden around here. The consequences can be very harsh.

9.Vlad the Younger: Sadly, no wells; that's another local taboo that is most likely going to make your work harder. This is all quite unfortunate, wouldn't you agree? But well-digging is forbidden around here. The consequences can be very harsh.

10.Bachelor: That's... unique. What is this thing before me then?

12.Bachelor: Do many people know about your well?

12.Bachelor: Do many people know about your well?

13.Vlad the Younger: In theory, no one, but I suspect that in practice many do. The only reason I haven't been buried inside of it is the lenience of the current Foreman of the Abattoir. But father has a stranglehold on him, which is quite a feat in itself.

8.Bachelor: What are their names?

8.Bachelor: What are their names?

9.Vlad the Younger: The Stone Yard spring is called Golgur. The etymology of the word is unclear, but it means something along the lines of 'a smooth mouthful'. The Spin-a-Yarn Square spring is called Typkhe, which simply means 'a well'. The ruined spring was called Sugagh Khadugh.

9.Vlad the Younger: The Stone Yard spring is called Golgur. The etymology of the word is unclear, but it means something along the lines of 'a smooth mouthful'. The Spin-a-Yarn Square spring is called Typkhe, which simply means 'a well'. The ruined spring was called Sugagh Khadugh.

10.Bachelor: I see. So the three of them are still supplying water, right? Or is it only two?

10.Bachelor: I see. So the three of them are still supplying water, right? Or is it only two?

11.Vlad the Younger: When Sugagh Khadugh was crushed, it flowed underground, but then returned to the surface. The locals maintain that it was angry with people, so it's chosen an evil place to do that. Popped out like a varicose vein in a place dramatically unfit for producing drinking water: by the cemetery, the Rotten Field, and the Khato dead pile.

11.Vlad the Younger: When Sugagh Khadugh was crushed, it flowed underground, but then returned to the surface. The locals maintain that it was angry with people, so it's chosen an evil place to do that. Popped out like a varicose vein in a place dramatically unfit for producing drinking water: by the cemetery, the Rotten Field, and the Khato dead pile.

12.Bachelor: What about the wells situation in the town?

12.Bachelor: What about the wells situation in the town?

13.Vlad the Younger: Sadly, no wells; that's another local taboo that is most likely going to make your work harder. This is all quite unfortunate, wouldn't you agree? But well-digging is forbidden around here. The consequences can be very harsh.

13.Vlad the Younger: Sadly, no wells; that's another local taboo that is most likely going to make your work harder. This is all quite unfortunate, wouldn't you agree? But well-digging is forbidden around here. The consequences can be very harsh.

14.Bachelor: That's... unique. What is this thing before me then?

15.Vlad the Younger: This is a secret. And I seem to be close to unravelling it.

16.Bachelor: Do many people know about your well?

16.Bachelor: Do many people know about your well?

17.Vlad the Younger: In theory, no one, but I suspect that in practice many do. The only reason I haven't been buried inside of it is the lenience of the current Foreman of the Abattoir. But father has a stranglehold on him, which is quite a feat in itself.

17.Vlad the Younger: In theory, no one, but I suspect that in practice many do. The only reason I haven't been buried inside of it is the lenience of the current Foreman of the Abattoir. But father has a stranglehold on him, which is quite a feat in itself.

21.Vlad the Younger: If I were you, I'd seize the Cathedral and the Theatre as soon as possible; those buildings have access to spring water. 1.Vlad the Younger: Tonight the patrols were grabbing anyone who looked even remotely suspicious; two dozen people were arrested just for having a knife or other weapon in their possession. Many were taken for not giving out Yaklakh's accomplices. Others-for looting the dead or their homes.

1.Vlad the Younger: Tonight the patrols were grabbing anyone who looked even remotely suspicious; two dozen people were arrested just for having a knife or other weapon in their possession. Many were taken for not giving out Yaklakh's accomplices. Others-for looting the dead or their homes.

2.Bachelor: What will happen to these people?

2.Bachelor: What will happen to these people?

3.Vlad the Younger: Almost all of them are innocent; there's no direct evidence that prove otherwise. They're awaiting the judgement of an inquisitor, who's bound to arrive here very soon-tomorrow night, I think, or early on the next day. But since it's going to be either Orff or Karminsky, I wouldn't expect much lenience.

3.Vlad the Younger: Almost all of them are innocent; there's no direct evidence that prove otherwise. They're awaiting the judgement of an inquisitor, who's bound to arrive here very soon-tomorrow night, I think, or early on the next day. But since it's going to be either Orff or Karminsky, I wouldn't expect much lenience.

4.Bachelor: Why are you so sure of their innocence?

4.Bachelor: Why are you so sure of their innocence?

5.Vlad the Younger: Because the patrolmen would have killed anyone proven guilty-however tenuous the accusation-during the arrest. If they didn't feel in the right ending those people's lives, then the arrested are innocent. Perhaps a few of them might just happen to be robbers, but that's pure coincidence...

5.Vlad the Younger: Because the patrolmen would have killed anyone proven guilty-however tenuous the accusation-during the arrest. 6.Bachelor: This is a disgrace! Rest assured that I will speak with Saburov about that.

8.Bachelor: With pleasure. An unexpected gesture from you, though. What's your motive?

8.Bachelor: With pleasure. An unexpected gesture from you, though. What's your motive?

9.Vlad the Younger: Duty. I don't readily sympathize with people regardless of which side of the bars they're on, but I feel responsible for any acts committed by those with power. It is my duty to undo and compensate at least a fraction of the damage inflicted by the law enforcers' incompetence.

9.Vlad the Younger: Duty. I don't readily sympathize with people regardless of which side of the bars they're on, but I feel responsible for any acts committed by those with power. It is my duty to undo and compensate at least a fraction of the damage inflicted by the law enforcers' incompetence.

10.Bachelor: I doubt Saburov will approve of your actions when he finds out.

10.Bachelor: Very well. I'll collect as much money as I can.

2.Bachelor: How many people have been arrested?

2.Bachelor: How many people have been arrested?

They'll take risks, rush headlong into infection hotspots thinking they have salvation in their pocket... and then the salvation won't work.

8.Bachelor: But who would buy unverified panacea?

And the heart incident has already become common knowledge... in certain circles at least.

19.Vlad the Younger: I've only been there four times in my life; the only way in for me has always been through the Termitary. Tycheek would always open and close it himself. But now he's dead, and you're out of luck.

17.Vlad the Younger: Yes. You can have a sample and analyze it if you will. A sample of sand and clay... If it's necessary, I can even call my people and have them dig it up again. But honestly... you're going to need a deeper hole than that.

18.Bachelor: No need for that. How can I get into the Abattoir?

19.Vlad the Younger: I've only been there four times in my life; the only way in for me has always been through the Termitary. Every morning a crowd of workmen comes out of it, walks between the buildings and is swallowed up by the Abattoir's main entrance-the one they call the Gorge. Tycheek would always open and close it himself. But now he's dead, and you're out of luck.

11.Vlad the Younger: A well and an epidemic... the concepts are inseparable, aren't they? Stories of the epidemics that happened during the Dark Ages always make mention of wells. Vagrants were hanged for poisoning them; infected meat was tossed there; bucketloads of plague were dredged up...

11.Vlad the Younger: A well and an epidemic... the concepts are inseparable, aren't they? Stories of the epidemics that happened during the Dark Ages always make mention of wells. Vagrants were hanged for poisoning them; infected meat was tossed there; bucketloads of plague were dredged up...

12.Bachelor: Yes, I've heard these stories.

12.Bachelor: Yes, I've heard these stories.

13.Vlad the Younger: As you can plainly see, there's no water in my well. It's empty. No one dredged up handfuls of poison from it. You can inspect the earth from the pile. The topmost layer of it belonged to the deepest underground one. It's just earth. Nothing out of the ordinary.

13.Vlad the Younger: As you can plainly see, there's no water in my well. It's empty. No one dredged up handfuls of poison from it. You can inspect the earth from the pile. The topmost layer of it belonged to the deepest underground one. It's just earth. Nothing out of the ordinary.

14.Bachelor: Then what did you need it for?

14.Bachelor: Then what did you need it for?

15.Vlad the Younger: Oh, all right. I lied to you. Obviously I'm not endeavouring to find oil here. The well is my first step towards a lifelong dream; an archaeological excavation. I'm interested in the ancient culture of the Steppe peoples. I'm studying strata. Layers.

15.Vlad the Younger: Oh, all right. I lied to you. Obviously I'm not endeavouring to find oil here. The well is my first step towards a lifelong dream; an archaeological excavation. I'm interested in the ancient culture of the Steppe peoples. I'm studying strata. Layers.

16.Bachelor: By the way, where did the taboo come from? Why is digging wells forbidden?

16.Bachelor: By the way, where did the taboo come from? Why is digging wells forbidden?

17.Vlad the Younger: It's not exactly taboo... According to a local legend, it's simply pointless-you won't find any water. 'The blood of the earth is hidden from the people.' That's from one of the local myths. And it's true: we've dug about a hundred meters down and found no moisture. Fascinating, isn't it?

17.Vlad the Younger: It's not exactly taboo... According to a local legend, it's simply pointless-you won't find any water. 'The blood of the earth is hidden from the people.' 18.Bachelor: Where do the springs come from then?

18.Bachelor: Where do the springs come from then?

19.Vlad the Younger: Oh, it's another curious phenomenon; I can't claim to be a specialist in this, though. But the builders, the ones who erected the Termitary and the stone houses in Earth, maintained that the springs are somehow enclosed in layers of solid compacted clay with sand deposits, through which water is supplied as if through pipes.

19.Vlad the Younger: Oh, it's another curious phenomenon; I can't claim to be a specialist in this, though. But the builders, the ones who erected the Termitary and the stone houses in Earth, maintained that the springs are somehow enclosed in layers of solid compacted clay with sand deposits, through which water is supplied as if through pipes.

20.Bachelor: Don’t lie to me, Vlad. I may not be a specialist in clay either, but I'm good enough at microbiology. The thing that's eating up your blood was born underground, in mineral deposits.

20.Bachelor: Don’t lie to me, Vlad. I may not be a specialist in clay either, but I'm good enough at microbiology. The thing that's eating up your blood was born underground, in mineral deposits.

21.Vlad the Younger: I don't know anything for sure. Moreover, I've found nothing to support that theory. The earth in the well is clean. And the deeper I dig, the cleaner and denser it becomes. Pure sand and solid white clay.

23.Vlad the Younger: Because if my theory proved to be correct, we would have had no choice but to raze the town's residential districts. Wipe out everything between the Abattoir and the Gorkhon.

29.Vlad the Younger: I've only been there four times in my life; the only way in for me has always been through the Termitary. Every morning a crowd of workmen comes out of it, walks between the buildings and is swallowed up by the Abattoir's main entrance-the one they call the Gorge. Tycheek would always open and close it himself. But now he's dead, and you're out of luck.

5.Vlad the Younger: Wait a minute... No, this can't be. The Kains were within a hair's breadth of destruction. The bull situation was arranged to smear their name and set the people against them. Who gave you this... unique idea? Because I can't believe that you've come to this conclusion on your own via logical inference.

6.Bachelor: Aglaya thinks Maria did it.

7.Vlad the Younger: Rubbish. Maria is innocent. Moreover, now I understand that she's our only hope. She's the only one who has the courage to keep building the thing that we've set the foundation of. The cowardly and the weak want the reliability, comfort, and confidence of tomorrow. They also want her dead.

4.Bachelor: Yes, I've heard about it.

4.Bachelor: Yes, I've heard about it.

5.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

5.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. 6.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

7.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

12.Bachelor: A disease?

13.Vlad the Younger: Could be flu or a hernia... I don't know what caused his death, and, frankly speaking, I don't care. When one of these ants dies, the rest loot bits and pieces of him, burying what's left afterwards. Are you asking out of professional curiosity?

13.Vlad the Younger: Could be flu or a hernia... I don't know what caused his death, and, frankly speaking, I don't care. When one of these ants dies, the rest loot bits and pieces of him, burying what's left afterwards. Are you asking out of professional curiosity?

14.Bachelor: Sort of.

14.Bachelor: Sort of.

15.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

16.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

19.Vlad the Younger: I'm taking you for a person that's looking for the killer and has the authority to punish him. I'm telling you-there is a rebellious outlaw beast out there. If he attacks you and you're forced to defend yourself, you are free to kill him.

21.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

15.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

16.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

18.Bachelor: Why is your family so concerned about public order?

19.Vlad the Younger: Because we are rulers. It has nothing to do with charity, trust me. We are in charge of production, after all. If the unrest becomes serious, the factories will stop. The Project will start failing... And we have contracts. We would lose money. I'm surprised I have to explain this to you.

21.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

9.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

11.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

17.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. 17.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

23.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

5.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

5.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

6.Bachelor: And?

6.Bachelor: And?

7.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

7.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. 8.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

8.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

9.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

10.Bachelor: And?

11.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

23.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

17.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

13.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

20.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

20.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

25.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

19.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

25.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

6.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

6.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

7.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

7.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

8.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

8.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

10.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

10.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

12.Bachelor: And?

13.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

24.Bachelor: Where can I find this monster?

25.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

19.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

13.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

15.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

27.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

21.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

27.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

4.Bachelor: I would like to hear you describe it.

4.Bachelor: I would like to hear you describe it.

5.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

5.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

6.Bachelor: And?

6.Bachelor: And?

7.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

7.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

8.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

8.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

9.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

9.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. 10.Bachelor: And?

10.Bachelor: And?

11.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

12.Bachelor: You think he is the killer?

13.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

23.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

17.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

13.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

20.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

20.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

25.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

19.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

25.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

6.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

6.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

7.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

7.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

8.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

8.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

10.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

10.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

12.Bachelor: And?

13.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

24.Bachelor: Where can I find this monster?

25.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

19.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

13.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

15.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

27.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

21.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

7.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

9.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

15.Vlad the Younger: Could be flu or a hernia... I don't know what caused his death, and, frankly speaking, I don't care. When one of these ants dies, the rest loot bits and pieces of him, burying what's left afterwards. Are you asking out of professional curiosity?

16.Bachelor: Sort of.

16.Bachelor: Sort of.

17.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

17.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

21.Vlad the Younger: Because we are rulers. It has nothing to do with charity, trust me. We are in charge of production, after all. If the unrest becomes serious, the factories will stop. The Project will start failing... And we have contracts. We would lose money. I'm surprised I have to explain this to you.

21.Vlad the Younger: Because we are rulers. It has nothing to do with charity, trust me. We are in charge of production, after all. If the unrest becomes serious, the factories will stop. 23.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

10.Bachelor: And why are you telling me this?

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

13.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

25.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

19.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

25.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

7.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

7.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

8.Bachelor: And?

8.Bachelor: And?

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. 10.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

12.Bachelor: And?

13.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

24.Bachelor: Where can I find this monster?

25.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

19.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

13.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.
