15.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

27.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

21.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

27.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

8.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

8.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

9.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

9.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

10.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

10.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

11.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

11.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

12.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

12.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

13.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

15.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

26.Bachelor: Where can I find this monster?

27.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

21.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

15.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

17.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

24.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

29.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

23.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

29.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

6.Bachelor: I would like to hear you describe it.

6.Bachelor: I would like to hear you describe it.

7.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

7.Vlad the Younger: The Termitary is a huge bunkhouse where the Bull Project workers live-although 'living' is the wrong term for it. They nest. They're nesting as a commune with a rather simple way of life. It could without reservation be called savage.

8.Bachelor: And?

8.Bachelor: And?

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

9.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

10.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

10.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

11.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. 12.Bachelor: And?

12.Bachelor: And?

13.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

14.Bachelor: You think he is the killer?

15.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

24.Bachelor: Where can I find this monster?

25.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

19.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

13.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

15.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

22.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

27.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

21.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

27.Vlad the Younger: You are correct. They barely know how to speak, but that only makes it worse... Halfmen, halfbeasts-if they start preaching, you feel as though you've encountered a doomsayer. I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

8.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

8.Bachelor: What is the Bull Project?

9.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

9.Vlad the Younger: It is the whole industrial system of the town, from the Abattoir to the goods station. Would you care to listen as to why I wanted to see you in the first place?

10.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

10.Bachelor: Very much so. Please go ahead.

11.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

11.Vlad the Younger: Let's get to the point then. A case of pointless, aimless unrest has occured in that hivemind's nest. The workers there are prone to lashing out from time to time like beasts frightened by a storm. They rage, they howl, they gnaw at one another... an unsightly image of a mass uprising.

12.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

12.Bachelor: What does this have to do with Simon's murder?

13.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

15.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

26.Bachelor: Where can I find this monster?

27.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

21.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

15.Vlad the Younger: Riots occured in the Termitary several times before. The mob goes crazy for a few days. Then they calm down just as unexpectedly-all of them at once. The sudden calm is just as void of reason as the unrest that had set them agog previously. Having a certain experience with the Kin, we simply block the entrance to this zoo off until the riot defeats itself.

17.Vlad the Younger: We usually lock them up beforehand. The evidence of an upcoming outbreak of mass lunacy becomes obvious in advance, and the Termitary's Father Superior informs us of it. But Father Tycheek has recently passed... a curious coincidence, don't you think? Mass anarchy... Anyway, a member of the Kin managed to run off into the town while we were busy taking measures.

The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

24.Bachelor: So you'd rather he kept mum about what is happening inside?

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

29.Vlad the Younger: He is most likely being harbored in a suspicious house... that's in the Crude Sprawl... Yes. My father is a man of rather hard-handed disposition-and quick-tempered to boot. If he finds out the Crude Sprawl is concealing a fugitive... he will make a mess. Pointless brutality serves no one. I'm looking for peace rather than blood, I'm telling you.

23.Vlad the Younger: I think you and I can help each other, doctor. You are looking for the killer, and I'm sure it is a runaway butcher. The title of a 'half-man' suits him very nicely. The Kains claim that Simon had not been killed by a human hand, don't they? And our family doesn't need unnecessary unrest in the town. This butcher can babble devil knows what. His mind is most likely clouded with insane ideas...

I need this butcher to disappear. Hand him over to the Kains or simply kill him if the beast attacks you. The reward will be hefty.

He used to live mostly in the Steppe-sometimes sleeping in the Termitary or at Lara Ravel's Shelter. But he's not there, I know that for sure. He went away to mourn his master. What would you have done if you were him?

16.Bachelor: I would have resigned myself and left the place for good. My investigation is over.

16.Bachelor: I would have resigned myself and left the place for good. My investigation is over.

16.Bachelor: I'd wait for him at the Kains'. It's simple.

16.Bachelor: I'd wait for him at the Kains'. It's simple.

16.Bachelor: I'd check every warehouse, of course. Perhaps I'd find something...

16.Bachelor: I'd check every warehouse, of course. Perhaps I'd find something...

10.Bachelor: Do you think Isidor had already been infected when he spoke with you?

10.Bachelor: Do you think Isidor had already been infected when he spoke with you?

11.Vlad the Younger: He was wrapped in a cloth and smelled of alcohol. He said these were preventative measures. But I still think he could have done all that just to convince me... after failing to convince my father. It was idiotic of me to fall for it!

11.Vlad the Younger: He was wrapped in a cloth and smelled of alcohol. He said these were preventative measures. But I still think he could have done all that just to convince me... after failing to convince my father. It was idiotic of me to fall for it!

12.Bachelor: But why?

12.Bachelor: But why?

13.Vlad the Younger: To stage a coup in the Kin! Isidor had resigned from internal Kin business a long time ago... and he passed his share of patriarchal power-and this power is very special, it's sacred like the power of a housefather... and his power used to be considerable... anyway, he passed it onto another person. Isidor has only been healing since then.

13.Vlad the Younger: To stage a coup in the Kin! Isidor had resigned from internal Kin business a long time ago... and he passed his share of patriarchal power-and this power is very special, it's sacred like the power of a housefather... and his power used to be considerable... anyway, he passed it onto another person. Isidor has only been healing since then.

14.Bachelor: And now he decided to come back and let Simon know straight away, right? And if the rumours of the plague are true...

14.Bachelor: And now he decided to come back and let Simon know straight away, right? And if the rumours of the plague are true...

8.Bachelor: Nothing, but I am counting on your... yes, your conscience. I'll find the whole truth out anyway-sooner rather than later.

9.Vlad the Younger: .....Isidor said... Note that I'm merely retelling it second-hand! He said there's an epidemic in the steppe camps. An outbreak of tarbagan sickness, perhaps... the plague, that is. Father... Father had issued an order to lock the Termitary up to prevent the infection from getting in.

9.Vlad the Younger: .....Isidor said... Note that I'm merely retelling it second-hand! He said there's an epidemic in the steppe camps. An outbreak of tarbagan sickness, perhaps... the plague, that is. Father... Father had issued an order to lock the Termitary up to prevent the infection from getting in.

10.Bachelor: And what are you so afraid of that you would conceal this? I don't understand. You did the right thing.

10.Bachelor: And what are you so afraid of that you would conceal this? I don't understand. You did the right thing.

11.Vlad the Younger: There is an underlying sensitive family matter here. To cut a long story short, my father would kill me if he found out about this conversation... The unrest in the Termitary, you see... well, I incited it to make father lock it up. He didn't believe Isidor.

13.Vlad the Younger: To stage a coup in the Kin! Isidor had resigned from internal Kin business a long time ago... and he passed his share of patriarchal power-and this power is very special, it's sacred like the power of a housefather... and his power used to be considerable... anyway, he passed it onto another person. Isidor has only been healing since then.

But the age of aurochses and bisons has irretrievably ended.
